name: sensitive-mac-addresses
description: A hardcoded list of MAC addresses was detected, potentially used for device identification or access control. Although MAC addresses themselves are not credentials, they may be exploited for MAC address spoofing attacks.
notes: MAC addresses may be used for device identification or MAC spoofing.

name: default-ssid
description: The default SSID name of the device was detected, which may be used to identify specific device models or brands.
notes: Default SSID may expose device information

name: device-info
description: Device model and name information detected, which could be used for targeted attacks.
notes: Device information may be used for targeted attacks

name: default-REDACTED_PASSWORD_PLACEHOLDER-credentials
notes: These are the default credentials for the device and should be changed upon first use.

name: REDACTED_SENSITIVE_DATA
notes: These are default wireless passwords and should be changed during device setup.

name: default-ftp-credentials
notes: These are the default credentials for the FTP service. If the FTP service is enabled, these credentials should be changed.

name: default-samba-credentials
notes: These are the default credentials for the Samba service. If the Samba service is enabled, these credentials should be changed.

name: default-wep-keys
notes: WEP encryption is inherently insecure; it is recommended to use more secure encryption methods such as WPA2 or WPA3.

name: cloud-server-info
description: Discovered cloud server address 'vi.ip-com.com.cn' and port '8080', which may be the device's remote management interface.
notes: The security of this remote management interface should be verified, and consideration should be given to whether it needs to be disabled.

name: nginx-REDACTED_PASSWORD_PLACEHOLDER-user
notes: It is recommended to run the Nginx service with a low-privilege user.

name: fastcgi-port-exposure
notes: It is recommended to check the authentication mechanism of the service on port 8188.

name: internal-path-exposure
notes: Check the access permissions of the directory
